props.name: hideHeader
props.docs: Hide application header. Will disable responsive feature of basic navigation.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Optional icon to be displayed next to the header label

props.name: ghost
props.docs: Ghost breadcrumbs will not show solid backgrounds on individual crumbs unless there is a mouse event (e.g. hover)

props.name: nextItems
props.docs: Items will be accessible through a dropdown

props.name: visibleItemCount
props.docs: Excess items will get hidden inside of dropdown

props.name: icon
props.docs: Icon to be displayed next ot the label

props.name: ghost
props.docs: Button with no background or outline

props.name: selected
props.docs: Show button as selected. Should be used with outline or ghost

props.name: showAllCount
props.docs: Overwrite the default show all count.

props.name: suppressOverflowHandling
props.docs: Suppress the overflow handling of child elements

Fire event when the collapse state is changed by the user

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: title-actions - Place additional actions inside title

props.name: categories
props.docs:
Configuration object hash used to populate the dropwdown menu for typeahead and quick selection functionality.
Each ID maps to an object with a label and an array of options to select from.

props.name: filterState
props.docs: A set of search criteria to populate the component with.

props.name: hideIcon
props.docs:
Allows to hide the icon inside the text input.
Defaults to false

props.name: icon
props.docs:
The icon next to the actual text input
Defaults to 'search'

props.name: initialState
props.docs:
When set this will initially populate the component with the provided search criteria.
This will trigger all input events accordingly.

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text: Will be removed with 2.0.0. Use the member filterState instead.

props.deprecation: Will be removed with 2.0.0. Use the member filterState instead.

props.name: nonSelectableCategories
props.docs:
In certain use cases some categories may not be available for selection anymore.
To allow proper display of set filters with these categories this ID to label mapping can be populated.

Configuration object hash used to supply labels to the filter chips in the input field.
Each ID maps to a string representing the label to display.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Placeholder text to be displayed in an empty input field.

props.name: repeatCategories
props.docs:
If set to true allows that a single category can be set more than once.
An already set category will not appear in the category dropdown if set to false.

Defaults to true

props.name: suggestions
props.docs: A list of strings that will be supplied as typeahead suggestions not tied to any categories.

events.docs: Event dispatched whenever the filter state changes.
Event dispatched whenever the text input changes.

props.name: active
props.docs:
Determines if the chip is interactive. If false no user input (e.g. mouse states, keyboard navigation)
will be possible and also the close button will not be present.

props.name: background
props.docs: Custom color for pill. Only working for `variant='custom'`

props.name: color
props.docs: Custom font color for pill. Only working for `variant='custom'`

events.docs: Fire event if close button is clicked
Fire event if close button is clicked
Triggered when back button is clicked

props.name: background
props.docs: Custom color for pill. Only working for `variant='custom'`

props.name: color
props.docs: Custom font color for pill. Only working for `variant='custom'`

props.name: eventDelimiter
props.docs:
Default behavior of the done event is to join the two events (date and time) into one combined string output.
This combination can be configured over the delimiter

props.name: format
props.docs:
Date format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: from
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the start date.
If set to `null` no default start date will be pre-selected.

Format is based on `format`

props.name: maxDate
props.docs:
The latest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: minDate
props.docs:
The earliest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: range
props.docs: If true a range of dates can be selected.

props.name: to
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the end date.
If the picker is not in range mode leave this value `null`

Format is based on `format`

methods.name: getCurrentDate
methods.signature: getCurrentDate() => Promise<{ start: string; end: string; }>

events.docs:
Date change event

If datepicker is in range mode the event detail will be sperated with a `-` e.g.
`2022/10/22 - 2022/10/24` (start and end). If range mode is chosen consider to use `dateRangeChange`.

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text: String output will be removed. Set ´doneEventDelimiter´ to undefined or null to get date change object instead of a string

events.deprecation: String output will be removed. Set ´doneEventDelimiter´ to undefined or null to get date change object instead of a string

events.docs:
Date range change.
Only triggered if datepicker is in range mode
Date selection confirmed via button action
Date selection confirmed via button action

Date format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: eventDelimiter
props.docs:
Default behavior of the done event is to join the two events (date and time) into one combined string output.
This combination can be configured over the delimiter

props.name: from
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the start date.

Format is based on `format`

props.name: maxDate
props.docs:
The latest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: minDate
props.docs:
The earliest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: showTimeReference
props.docs:
Show time reference input
Time reference is default aligned with @see {this.timeFormat}

props.name: timeFormat
props.docs:
Time format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: to
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the end date.
If the picker is not in range mode leave this value `null`

Format is based on `format`

events.detail: { from: string; to: string; time: string; }

Done event

Set `doneEventDelimiter` to null or undefine to get the typed event

props.docs: Whether the item is checked or not. If true a checkmark will mark the item as checked.

props.docs: Disable item and remove event listeners

props.name: layout
props.docs: Optional empty state layout - one of 'large', 'compact' or 'compactBreak'

props.name: animated
props.docs: Animate state change transitions. Defaults to 'true'.

props.name: chevron
props.docs: Display a chevron icon in list items. Defaults to 'false'

props.name: itemHeight
props.docs:
Determines the height of list items.
This can either be one of two predefined sizes ('S' or 'L') or an absolute pixel value.
In case a number is supplied it will get converted to rem internally.
Defaults to 'S'.

props.name: chevron
props.docs: Show chevron on right side of the event list item

props.name: color
props.docs:
Color of the status indicator.
Allowed values are all Core UI color names.

props.name: opacity
props.docs:
Opacity of the status indicator.
Defaults to 1.0

props.name: selected
props.docs: Show event list item as selected

props.name: fullWidth
props.docs: If true the search field will fill all available horizontal space of it's parent container when expanded.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true the filter chip will be in disabled state

The index of the selected group entry.
If undefined no group item is selected.

The elements tabindex attribute will get set accordingly.
If true tabindex will be 0, -1 otherwise.

Adds a dimming layer to the modal.
This should only be used when it it necessary to focus the user's attention to the dialog content (e.g. errors, warnings, complex tasks).
